newsitem.title: ZIMBABWE: ZIMBABWE MONEY MARKET LIQUID, RATES MIXED.
newsitem.headline: ZIMBABWE MONEY MARKET LIQUID, RATES MIXED.

text.p: Short-term trading rates on Zimbabwe's money market were quoted mixed in continued liqudity on Friday, dealers said.
"There really isn't much activity at the moment but the market should be very liquid because we are expecting Z$450 worth of maturities," one dealer commented.
The treasury bill rate remained at 19.60 percent after Thursday's weekly tender and on Friday discount houses were selling the central bank paper back into the market at 19.50 percent.
NCD bills with maturity of 30, 60 and 90 days were being bought and sold at 23.50 and 20.50 percent respectively while bankers acceptance bills were at 22 and 19.50 percent from 21 and 20.50 percent.
Call money shed three percentage points to 20 percent in a market which opened in surplus of Z$56 million from Z$157 million on Thursday. --Stella Mapenzauswa, Harare Newsroom: +263-4 72 52 28/9--
